chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melody Victoria Nieves

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on December 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Re: Bond Modification
Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

11:30 AM DA calls cases: 22CF03. 20CM132 and states appearances. Defendant Melody Victoria Nieves in court.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Melody Victoria Nieves.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. In case 22CF03 DA Kelz calls Sam Heitl a former Phillips Police Officer. Witness sworn. Direct questioning of the witness by DA Kelz. Witness identifies the defendant on record. Cross examination of the witness by Attorney Restemayer. Re-direct by DA Kelz. Witness excused. Statement by DA Kelz. Statement by Attorney Restemayer. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled for 09/20/2022. Attorney Restemayer gives Status update in case 20CM132. DA Kelz requests the Misdemeanor case track along with the felony case. So Ordered.
1 Bond for 2 cases: 20CM132 and 22CF3
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing

3:02 PM DA Karl Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Melody Victoria Nieves appeared by video, in custody from PCJ.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court gives history of case and questions DE on attorney. DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing. DE has not waived preliminary hearing. Adj. 3:06 PM
Pre-trial conference on August 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11AM
1 certified copy returned from PCSO

CB-$500 / SB-$2,000 (1 bond for both 20CM132 and 22CF3)
If not already completed Defendant must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): B.S.W. dob 3/13/76

9:05 AM  Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melody Victoria Nieves appeared by video, in custody.  DA Kelz states cases (20CM132 and 22CF3).  Court states history of cases and questions DE regarding her nonappearances in both cases.  DE responds.  DA responds and states history of nonappearances in 20CM132.  DA moves to quash warrants in both cases.  DA states recommendation as to bond ($1,000.00 cash bond for both cases).  Court questions DE regarding bond.  DE responds requesting bond be lowered.   Court addresses Initial Appearance in 22CF33.  DE states she did not receive copy of complaint.  Court reads charge, penalties and summary of basis portion.  DE waives further reading of complaint. Court advises DE regarding her right to an attorney.  DE states she has contacted the Public Defenders Office for an attorney.  DE states she does want a Preliminary Hearing and time limits not waived.   Court sets bond at $500.00 Cash + $2,000.00 Signature Bond for both cases.  Conditions:  No contact with B.S.W. dob 3/13/76.   Pre-trial conference set for 8/18/22 at 11AM.  Court orders warrants in both cases quashed.
Return on warrant on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
$1,000 warrant + $50 warrant fee
Cancelled due to an error on the warrant per PRSO. Re-issued 02/03/2022
$1,000 warrant + $50 warrant fee

10:38 AM Defendant Melody Victoria Nieves not in court.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the history in the case and notices sent. Court states there is a certificate of NON service in the case. DA Kelz makes comments in regards to communication with the defendant. DA Kelz requests an arrest warrant. So ordered plus warrant fee.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA
